column21: What did you not like about the tool?
column22: Feel free to provide any suggestions or ideas what feature could be added to support users better during the prototyping process

column20: Easy to use and user friendly
column22: Currently it would be sufficient, but with new requirements more ideas would pop up (like adding own templates)

column20: Simpleness
column21: Some standard features were not included like ctrl-c

column20: Search bar for similar prototypes
column22: Nicer look and feel of the prototyping software

column20: many examples mockups which made it easy to integrate several icons; very easy to use
column21: some functions are missing like coloring the background of a label, different fonts (like they where in the first Mockup Tool)
column22: adding functions like different fonts, background coloring, adding own images or icons

column20: Very Easy To Use
column21: Many functionalities were missing, not very in-depth
column22: Incorporate more functionalities from the MockupClassic tool (e.g. Change size more easily, more components to add, ...)

column20: Quick and fitting search results, which supported the design of the use case which I had to design
column21: There could be more convenience features like multi-selection, resizing and so on
column22: As I said I would like to have more convenience features or to be able to modify copied UI-Components further for example

column20: it is simple to use and enables me to reuse existing screens and edit them as needed
column21: nothing as i do not miss anything for the tasks to solve in the study

column20: Clean UI, Auto-Correct
column21: Missing customizability functions after selecting a base GUI template

column20: Easy to use, easy search, no previous knowledge necessary, nice and relevant templates
column21: No keyboard shortcuts like copy or paste, no adjustment for the forms and buttons, no support of selecting multiple objects
column22: keyboard shortcuts like copy or paste, adjustment for the forms and buttons, support of selecting multiple objects, zoom

column20: Helped with GUI-suggestions and was easy to use.

I like that you can search with terms or sentences that might be relevant for your prototype and then get inspiration from the screens that are displayed as a search result for your own GUI. In addition, it is very nice that you can simply drag and drop components from existing GUIs to anywhere where you need them.
column21: It would be nice if buttons and images could be resized. Another minor function that might be quite helpful is a revert function that is able to revert recent actions.

column20: The Visualization of finished GUIs and the ability to reuse other GUIs
column21: GUI elements are sometimes not compatible with each other and there are not enough options to modify them.
column22: Allow the import of own images and icons

column20: Seeing real GUIs for inspiration and being able to edit them on the fly. I also liked the partition of the screen into Source/Workspace/Result which corresponds to my workflow. The tool is very easy and intuitive to use.
column21: There's no unified design for the GUIs, which makes everything look a bit random. And there's no undo button ;)
column22: More simple components in addition to the real GUIs - then you don't have to find every small icon somewhere in an app.

column20: I like the search functionality, that enables you to find many relevant examples for different domains and the ability to reuse UI components that are found of different screens simply by using drag-and-drop. Also the option to right-click in the Create Wireframe browser and select different commands, e.g. delete gui, transition or UI component or 'Create New' is very handy. Especially, the command 'Create New' is very useful, because it allows the user to quickly create a new type of component from a list of frequently used components.
column21: Some of the functionalities could be made more usable. For instance, the option to copy a UI component can be made to work with Keyboard controls instead of simply using right click and selecting the copy command. Also the selection of multiple UI Components from a given screen should be made possible, as well as moving the selection between screens.
column22: Enable more keyboard shortcuts for the existing commands like copy (also see prev. answer).

column20: Amount of Templates and Drag and Drop
column21: Copy of own text lables did not work directly
column22: Auto suggestions for relevant/additional search terms to find a template more quickly

column20: very easy to use, good to get first result very fast
column22: Resizing, strg c strg v, lines that help to arange different objectives

column20: Many template to choose from; Search query works well,
column21: Unable to adjust the size, font etc. If we edit the original text, we lost the original fonts. Unable to upload custom image.
column22: Edit Mode to adjust the size, font, color etc... The selection of UI components, e.g. batch selection and unselect if we click on the background or somewhere else, because it is easy to create a link between two GUI by mistake.

column20: Quick progress because of inspirations
column21: Some GUIs were not able to use

column20: Allows very quick building of guis. Presets give an inspiration
column21: Usability could be better sometimes. Presets can distract from what I want to build.
column22: Selecting and moving multiple components. Resizing images. Maybe extract elements from found guis and let the user use them individually without having to extract them from the gui manually.
